lead_paragraph: LONDON, Oct. 6 (U.P.) -- Britain almost trapped "most of the German Fleet" at the start of the Norwegian campaign in April, 1940, it was revealed today in a 130-page booklet called "Bomber Command." The booklet discloses that failure of a radio message to get through may have prevented the British Fleet from engaging the German Fleet while it was enroute to Norway.
abstract: Official Brit pub Bomber Command says radio message failure may have prevented Brit from engaging German Fleet while en route to Norway
